content: If we are allowed to treat health insurance like we’re in a cafeteria, and can customize our insurance plan to cover only conditions that we might get, then I (as a woman) would like my plan to exclude erectile dysfunction, prostate problems, PSA tests, and anything else that affects only males. I’m at very low risk for prostate cancer, and I don’t see why I should have to pay for my insurance to cover that. /snark off This whole “only pay for what you’re at risk for” song and dance is getting ridiculous. Which is why we need a single payer system that covers everyone, regardless of what medical situations they may have.
